subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: Frank Ratka
full_text:
--0-776798122-1244491534=:763
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tell me where the seperation on the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and =
300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves that our ears read as vibratio=
n and our mind translates as sound. The waves are still on the electromagne=
tic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are present on the scale. Wha=
t I mean by power can be directll translated to volume or amplitude. The on=
ly thing that distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave is the fact that=
 we can hear them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@...=
> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM












=
No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form =
of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in the air=
 (or in other substances).=A0 Our ears detect these pressure waves and tran=
slate them into sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy=
.=A0 Our eyes do: that part which we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8=
/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warr=
ior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM









It sounds like she's =
saying "one, two, ....."
=A0
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinkin=
g that there are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sou=
nd waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is f=
requency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certa=
in block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same s=
pectrum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic w=
aves can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorte=
r the wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of mic=
rowaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but=
 the waves also have a physical effect on our environment by causing molecu=
les to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infr=
ared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just cause=
s molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its =
a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiat=
ion.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombie=
gh ostresearch. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh =
ostresearch. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some =
food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th inves=
tigation.
=A0
It was me and another girl teammate=A0present in the room. I =
picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with=
 me. We were standing right next to another digital video recorder that I l=
eave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd =
voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see=
 if she picked it up.
=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from =
sound waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodi=
ed voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This =
instance with the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder sh=
ould have picked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=
=A0
I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"=
01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", =
and then another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this unti=
l playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's fro=
m the last investigation.
=A0
=A0

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Fran=
k Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
=
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








I have a running theory that EVP i=
s carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it =
to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrason=
ic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract t=
hem together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, =
if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a r=
oom creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermed=
iate difference=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz =
to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates=
 ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt=
 that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are ab=
le to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems =
but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercia=
l produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.
=

From: Zack =
Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM





Fascinating! I've =
had this idea that the EVP are often=A0not recorded by the microphone but s=
omehow make their way in at the actual=A0point where the storage is made, w=
hether it be analog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Za=
ck

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombi=
egh ostresearch. com> wrote:









I monitor my audio live. The funny th=
ing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in t=
he environment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon p=
layback.
=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .com 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] New ideas




I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a re=
mote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an i=
nvestigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had=
 six video cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for=
 all=A0was being monitored and recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we d=
id not have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central locatio=
n. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8=
, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote=
:

=A0
Let's just agree to end this discussion about her... 
Why don't we d=
iscuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either =
evp or ITC? 
Al

<TD vAlign=3Dtop>
<DIV>I have a running theory that EV=
P is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want =
it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultra=
sonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtrac=
t them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For exampl=
e, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in =
a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a inter=
mediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range =
(20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment gen=
erates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I alway=
s felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
<=
DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radi=
o with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some=
 passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr=
. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
